name: Acolyte
description: A childhood spent in a monastery taught you well for a life of piety.

exploitChoices.name: Daily Worship
exploitChoices.description: Once per day, you may pray to your deity and refresh your LUCK (or “faith” as you view it) dice pool.

name: Apprentice
description: You learned valuable skills as a child, apprenticed to a smith or craftsman.

exploitChoices.name: Quick Learner
exploitChoices.description: You are able to pick up skills quickly. Skills (but not attributes) cost you one less XP to acquire or advance than they normally would.

name: Bastard
description: You were brought up by a family, but you never really belonged and had to learn to fit in.

exploitChoices.name: Adaptable
exploitChoices.description: You find it easy to fit in with others, adapting to their ways. When part of a group making a group attribute check, you gain a bonus +1d6 to the check.

name: Chosen One
description: There was always something special about you. You are prophesied, with a destiny greater than yourself.

exploitChoices.name: Here for a Reason
exploitChoices.description: Once (and only once) when you would normally die, you instead wake up one day later with full HEALTH. The gods—or some other power—still have need of you.

name: Commoner
description: Just a small-town kid, living in a small-time world.

exploitChoices.name: Practical
exploitChoices.description: You gain three [crafting] or [hobby] skills of your choice at one rank; this does not increase an existing skill higher than one rank.

name: Farmhand
description: You grew up on a farm, learning about crops and livestock.

exploitChoices.name: Outdoorsman
exploitChoices.description: You recognise plants, and are able to identify them and their properties by sight.

name: Feral
description: You grew up alone in the wild, your only friends the animals who surrounded you.

exploitChoices.name: King of the Wild
exploitChoices.description: Choose a terrain such as jungle, desert, or arctic. You are able to communicate with semi-sentient creatures (animals) from that terrain type, although this does not guarantee their friendship or grant them particular knowledge or intelligence.

name: Noble
description: You had a privileged upbringing surrounded by luxury.

exploitChoices.name: Silver Spoon
exploitChoices.description: Your wealthy upbringing means that you start play with 1,000 bonus gold coins and a superior quality set of clothing.

name: Nomad
description: Traveling is your way of life, never staying still too long.

exploitChoices.name: Wanderer
exploitChoices.description: When traveling, you (and your party) automatically gain +1 to your travel score at the start of each day.

name: Page
description: You spent years in the service of a lord or lady, learning the ways of court, running messages, cleaning, and serving a noble.

exploitChoices.name: Page Gear
exploitChoices.description: You start play with a superior set of clothing and a high-quality musical instrument.

name: Primitive
description: You grew up in a tribe that knew little of civilization.

exploitChoices.name: Fleet
exploitChoices.description: You gain +2 to your Speed when outdoors in a non-urban environment. This does not stack with other exploits that add to your Speed.

name: Slave
description: A lifetime of forced servitude and labor has toughened you mentally and physically.

exploitChoices.name: Hardship
exploitChoices.description: A life of oppression has taught you to endure hardship; you gain an extra death/dying countdown die when reduced below 0 HEALTH.

name: Urchin
description: A rough childhood on the streets taught you how to survive.

exploitChoices.name: Life on the Streets
exploitChoices.description: Accustomed to sleeping rough, you heal a bonus 1d6 HEALTH each day.

name: Wizard’s Apprentice
description: Your childhood was an academic one of study and lore.

exploitChoices.name: Legerdemain
exploitChoices.description: You have learned a number of little magical tricks that you’ve used to help with your chores as an apprentice. You are able to use small displays of magical sleight of hand at will to assist you with day-to-day inconveniences: cleaning clothes, keeping the rain or mud off, a tiny reading light, polishing silverware, and the like.
